intro: Timonius trichanthus var. dolichophyllus, commonly known as the long-leaf timonius, is a rare and unique plant species characterized by its elongated, lance-shaped leaves. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often found in woodland areas with rich, loamy soil. Its leaves are covered in fine, soft hairs, giving them a silvery appearance under sunlight. This variation is notable for its distinctive leaf morphology, which sets it apart from other members of the species.
